Proactively seeking feedback from stakeholders, including customers and internal teams, to identify areas for improvement and refine processes for capturing and addressing customer concerns.

What you'll do?

•     Performing data analysis, utilizing statistical and analytical techniques to analyze security incident data. This includes identifying trends, patterns, and anomalies, and supporting with the formulation of recommendations to reduce risk.
•     Creating visual representations of security incident data to make complex information more understandable for stakeholders, utilizing tools such as ServiceNow and Splunk dashboards to communicate insights effectively.

•     Working closely with security analysts globally to understand their data needs and providing them with relevant and actionable insights to assist with their day-to-day roles.

•     Evaluating the performance of data analysis tools and recommending improvements or optimizations. This may involve exploring new tools or suggesting enhancements to existing ones.
•     Staying informed about the latest trends in data analysis, statistical methods, and tools to continually improve analytical skills and contribute effectively to the SOC's mission.
What you'll bring:
•     Strong knowledge and experience of data science and data analytics         
•     Excellent communication skills (both spoken and written English), including the ability to write comprehensive reports and create engaging slide decks.  
•     Strong attention to detail and the ability to handle multiple competing priorities and simultaneous cases in a fast-paced environment.  
•     Knowledge and experience in various components of SOC infrastructure, including monitoring and intrusion detection systems, and the management and responding to cybersecurity incidents.
